Header: Coronavirus hits GM Q1 profit hard
Description: [DETROIT] General Motors on Wednesday reported a huge plunge in first-quarter quarter profit as it burned through cash with its the North American vehicle production shut down due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Header: US may require masks at airports in changes to limit coronavirus
Description: [WASHINGTON] The lead US airport security agency is weighing the possibility of requiring masks or face coverings for passengers who pass through checkpoints, according to a US official and two people familiar with the deliberations.

Header: Volkswagen sees multi-speed coronavirus rebound led by China
Description: [FRANKFURT] Volkswagen said demand in China was rebounding, thanks to customers who want to switch from public transport to personal vehicles, but warned sales would not recover as quickly in other parts of the world.

Header: 788 new coronavirus cases in Singapore, taking total past 20,000
Description: [SINGAPORE] The Ministry of Health (MOH) has preliminarily confirmed 788 new Covid-19 cases in Singapore as of Wednesday noon, taking the total count in the country past 20,000.

Header: BMW reports first-quarter profit rise as coronavirus saps demand
Description: [FRANKFURT] BMW on Wednesday reported a 133 per cent rise in first-quarter profit, due to the absence of a one-off provision in the year-earlier period, but said the impact of the coronavirus could erode demand and profit.

Header: US coronavirus deaths rise by 2,333 in 24 hours: Johns Hopkins
Description: [WASHINGTON] The US coronavirus death toll climbed by 2,333 in the past 24 hours, a tally by Johns Hopkins University showed on Tuesday, more than twice as many as the day before.

Header: New Zealand Q1 jobless rate inches up but coronavirus shock to be reflected in next quarter
Description: [WELLINGTON] New Zealand's jobless rate rose to 4.2 per cent in the first quarter ahead of a strict lockdown that was enforced to limit the spread of the novel coronavirus, according to data released by Statistics New Zealand on Wednesday.

Header: France daily coronavirus deaths rise to 330
Description: [PARIS] France on Tuesday recorded 330 new coronavirus deaths over the last 24 hours, a rise in the daily toll as the country prepares to begin easing lockdown measures in less than a week.

Header: White House readies to scrap Trump's coronavirus task force
Description: [WASHINGTON] In the latest sign that the Trump administration no longer considers the coronavirus pandemic its top daily priority, the White House is set to disband the emergency task force handling the outbreak.

Header: Disney to see at least US$1.4b impact from coronavirus
Description: [SAN FRANCISCO] Walt Disney said Tuesday it will see an impact of some $1.4 billion from the coronavirus in the current fiscal quarter as a result of a massive hit to its theme parks and other operations.

Header: Oil prices surge as coronavirus lockdowns ease
Description: [NEW YORK] Oil prices soared on Tuesday, as some European and Asian countries along with several US states began to ease coronavirus lockdown measures.

Header: EU backs call for independent probe into coronavirus origins
Description: THE European Union will put forward a proposal to the World Health Assembly (WHA) calling for an independent probe into the origins of the coronavirus, according to Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison.

Header: US: Wall St jumps as oil recovers, coronavirus-lockdown eases
Description: [NEW YORK] Wall Street's main stock indexes opened higher on Tuesday as oil prices staged a recovery and a slew of countries eased coronavirus-led restrictions in an attempt to revive economic activity.

Header: Hong Kong eases some restrictions as new coronavirus cases dwindle
Description: [HONG KONG] Hong Kong's government said on Tuesday it will relax restrictions on public gatherings and allow gyms, cinemas and beauty parlours to re-open later this week as only a handful of new coronavirus cases have been reported in recent weeks.

Header: Thai PM says coronavirus impact may last another 9 months
Description: [BANGKOK] Thailand may see the economic impact from the coronavirus pandemic spread over another nine months, the country's prime minister said on Tuesday, as disruption from the global crisis drags on tourism and domestic activity.

Header: 605 of the 632 new coronavirus cases in Singapore are foreign workers from dorms; 9 new clusters
Description: [SINGAPORE] Foreign workers staying in dormitories continue to make up the vast majority of new Covid-19 cases here, with 605 of the 632 cases announced on Tuesday (May 5), belonging to this group.

Header: Christie's sale to help charity's coronavirus fund after Cannes postponement
Description: [NEW YORK] Auction house Christie's will hold a sale to help raise money for amfAR's COVID-19 research fund after coronavirus forced the cancellation of the AIDS charity's famous Cannes Film Festival gala.

Header: Coronavirus will constrain US meat supply despite Trump order: Tyson Foods
Description: [CHICAGO] The coronavirus crisis will continue to idle US meat plants and slow production, Tyson Foods Inc said on Monday, signaling more disruptions to the US food supply after US President Donald Trump ordered facilities to stay open.

Header: Smithfield starts to reopen US pork plant shut by coronavirus
Description: [CHICAGO] Smithfield Foods Inc, the world's biggest pork processor, resumed limited operations on Monday at a massive South Dakota slaughterhouse it closed last month because of the coronavirus pandemic, the union representing plant employees said.

Header: Israel isolates coronavirus antibody in 'significant breakthrough': Israeli defence minister
Description: [JERUSALEM] Israel has isolated a key coronavirus antibody at its main biological research laboratory, the Israeli defence minister said on Monday, calling the step a "significant breakthrough" toward a possible treatment for the COVID-19 pandemic.

Header: New Zealand joins Australia's coronavirus cabinet meeting to discuss travel hub
Description: [SYDNEY] New Zealand's prime minister joined Australia's coronavirus cabinet meeting on Tuesday as the neighbouring countries discuss reopening their borders to trans-Tasman travel following their successes in containing the disease.

Header: US coronavirus deaths rise by 1,015 in 24 hours, lowest in a month: Johns Hopkins
Description: [WASHINGTON] Novel coronavirus deaths in the United States rose by 1,015 in the past 24 hours, a tally by Johns Hopkins University showed on Monday - the lowest one-day figure in a month.

Header: Global coronavirus death toll tops 250,000: AFP tally
Description: [PARIS] More than 250,000 people worldwide have died from the novel coronavirus, more than 85 per cent of them in Europe and the United States, according to an AFP tally of official figures at 2230 GMT on Monday.

Header: Niger labour minister died from coronavirus: public TV
Description: [NIAMEY] The novel coronavirus caused the death of Niger's minister of employment and labour, Mohamed Ben Omar, public television announced on Monday.

Header: Europe must pull together to tackle coronavirus crisis; reforms at risk
Description: EURO zone finance ministers will have much to reflect on when they meet, by video conference, this week to discuss Europe's response to the novel coronavirus crisis.

Header: Singdollar could weaken to 1.425 per USD this year on coronavirus risks: Fitch Solutions
Description: FITCH Solutions has lowered its forecast for the Singapore dollar's (SGD) 2020 average exchange rate to S$1.425 per US dollar (USD), from its previous average forecast of S$1.385, in light of the Covid-19 crisis.

Header: Migrant workers in Malaysia to undergo coronavirus tests as curbs eased
Description: [KUALA LUMPUR] Migrant workers in Malaysia are now required to be tested for the new coronavirus, a senior minister said, as the government eased six-week long curbs on movement and businesses.

Header: UK refuses to comment on intelligence dossier on China's coronavirus response
Description: [LONDON] Britain's defence minister on Monday declined to comment on media reports that a dossier by the US-led Five Eyes intelligence consortium had said that China lied about the novel coronavirus outbreak.

Header: 560 of 573 new coronavirus cases in Singapore are foreign workers from dorms; 3 new clusters
Description: [SINGAPORE] Foreign workers living in dormitories made up 560 of the 573 new coronavirus cases on Monday (May 4).

Header: Commuters stream to work as Malaysia lifts coronavirus curbs on movement
Description: [KUALA LUMPUR] Thousands of Malaysians joined the morning rush hour on Monday as the government eased curbs on movement and businesses for the first time in six weeks, looking to restart an economy racked by the coronavirus pandemic.

Header: Maze parks to micromarkets: How coronavirus could bring cities closer to home
Description: [BARCELONA] In the once-bustling Eixample district, birdsong and the occasional whir of a food delivery cyclist have replaced the continuous din of passing traffic - making lockdown life unexpectedly bucolic in this Barcelona neighbourhood.

Header: Worldwide coronavirus cases exceed 3.5 million: AFP tally
Description: [PARIS] The number of confirmed coronavirus cases worldwide surpassed 3.5 million on Monday, with three quarters of them in Europe and the United States, an AFP tally based on official sources showed.

Header: US coronavirus deaths rise by 1,450 in 24 hours: Johns Hopkins
Description: [WASHINGTON] Novel coronavirus deaths in the United States climbed by 1,450 in the past 24 hours, a tally by Johns Hopkins University showed Sunday, bringing the total number of fatalities to more than 67,600.

Header: Trump says US to have coronavirus vaccine by end of year
Description: [WASHINGTON] President Donald Trump on Sunday said the United States will have a coronavirus vaccine by the end of this year.

Header: Brazil's Bolsonaro headlines anti-democratic rally amid alarm over handling of coronavirus
Description: [BRASILIA] Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro attacked Congress and the courts in a speech to hundreds of supporters on Sunday as the number of coronavirus cases blew past 100,000 in Brazil, underlining the former army captain's increasing isolation as he downplays the impacts of the pandemic.

Header: Greece sees economy tanking this year on coronavirus impact
Description: [ATHENS] Greece expects its economy to contract by 4.7 per cent to 8.9 per cent this year under baseline and adverse scenarios taking into account the impact of the coronavirus pandemic in the government's 2020-21 stability programme submitted to the EU Commission projects.

Header: Coronavirus leaves America's municipal finances in tatters
Description: IN Dayton, Ohio, Mayor Nan Whaley has furloughed a quarter of the city's workforce and is warning that more cuts may follow. In Baltimore, which has one of the highest murder rates in the nation, Mayor Bernard Young is negotiating layoffs with the police union. And, in Houston, Mayor Sylvester Turner is deferring all five police cadet classes.

Header: Small coronavirus outbreak at Australian meat factory as cases keep dropping
Description: [MELBOURNE] A small coronavirus cluster has emerged at a meat factory in the Australian state of Victoria, health officials said on Saturday, as parts of the country started easing social distancing restrictions after suppressing the infection rate to below 1 per cent.

Header: Will US exchange trading floors still be relevant post-coronavirus?
Description: [NEW YORK] The coronavirus pandemic has upended US equities trading with unprecedented market volatility and forced bourses like the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) to close their trading floors, raising questions about the need for such spaces.

Header: Malaysia rounding up migrants to contain coronavirus spread, police say
Description: [KUALA LUMPUR] Malaysian authorities are rounding up undocumented migrants as part of efforts to contain the spread of coronavirus, the country's police chief said late on Friday, after hundreds of migrants and refugees were detained in the capital Kuala Lumpur.

Header: China reports one new coronavirus case versus 12 a day earlier
Description: [BEIJING] China reported one new coronavirus case for May 1, down from 12 a day earlier, data from the country's health authority showed on Saturday.

Header: US coronavirus stimulus went to some healthcare providers facing criminal inquiries
Description: [WASHINGTON] Eager to bolster the healthcare system during the coronavirus pandemic, the US government last month sped US$30 billion in stimulus payments to most healthcare providers that billed Medicare last year.

Header: US Republicans push for coronavirus lawsuit immunity for business
Description: [WASHINGTON] The top Republicans in the US Congress displayed a united front on Friday in their drive for coronavirus-related liability protections for businesses, saying such measures will be crucial to talks about future relief legislation.

Header: White House blocks Fauci from testifying to Congress on coronavirus response
Description: [WASHINGTON] Top US health official Anthony Fauci will not testify next week to a congressional committee examining the Trump administration's response to the coronavirus pandemic, the White House said on Friday, calling it "counterproductive" to have individuals involved in the response testify.

Header: Trump now says he hopes US coronavirus deaths less than 100,000
Description: [WASHINGTON] President Donald Trump on Friday seemingly increased his estimate of possible deaths in the United States from the coronavirus, telling a White House event he hopes for less than 100,000 fatalities, a higher upper limit than the 60,000 to 70,000 deaths he discussed on Monday.

Header: Millions had risen out of poverty. Coronavirus is pulling them back
Description: LIKE thousands of women across South Asia, Shahida Khatun dropped out of school to work in the garment factories that were springing up in Bangladesh's cities, hoping to pull her family out of poverty.

Header: 932 new coronavirus cases in Singapore on Friday, as total crosses 17,000
Description: [SINGAPORE] There are 932 new Covid-19 cases in Singapore, taking the total count to 17,101, said the Ministry of Health (MOH) on Friday.

Header: Macau's April gaming revenues plunge 96.8% on coronavirus impact
Description: [HONG KONG] Gambling revenue in Macau plunged 96.8 per cent in April year-on-year, with casinos reeling in the world's biggest casino hub as authorities imposed a raft of measures to keep visitors away to contain the coronavirus outbreak.

Header: More than 2,000 US coronavirus deaths in 24 hours: tracker
Description: [WASHINGTON] The United States recorded more than 2,000 coronavirus deaths in a 24-hour period for the third day running, according to the latest real-time tally on Thursday reported by Johns Hopkins University.

Header: UK 'past peak' of coronavirus outbreak: PM Johnson
Description: [LONDON] Britain is "past the peak" of its coronavirus outbreak, Prime Minister Boris Johnson said on Thursday, despite recording another 674 deaths in the last 24 hours.

Header: Japan's March factory output, retail sales drop as novel coronavirus hits economy
Description: JAPAN'S March factory output fell at the fastest pace in five months, while retail sales also dropped as businesses struggled with the Covid-19 pandemic's sharp hit to overseas and domestic demand.

Header: Creativity in the Time of Coronavirus
Description: Do you have a family member who refuses to stay home and you are tired of nagging them to? Local design firm Stuck, has designed a series of doorknob hangers reminding people not to leave their homes unnecessarily.

Header: Finance, tech firms on hiring spree amid coronavirus turmoil: LinkedIn
Description: [LONDON] The coronavirus is roiling global job markets, but the picture is not all gloomy. Finance, technology and consumer goods firms are hiring tens of thousands in the US and other countries, according to data from Microsoft Corp's professional networking site LinkedIn.

Header: Thailand to reopen some businesses as new coronavirus cases slow
Description: [BANGKOK] Thailand will start reopening on Sunday some businesses, such as outdoor markets, barber shops and pet groomers, after the numbers of new coronavirus infections dropped into single digits this week, a government spokesperson said.

Header: Germany’s new coronavirus cases increase the most in 4 days
Description: [BERLIN] The number of new coronavirus cases in Germany rose the most in four days as the government considers further steps to ease restrictions on daily life.

Header: Coronavirus plunges French economy into worst post-war slump
Description: [PARIS] France saw its sharpest economic contraction since World War II in the first quarter as a lockdown from mid-March left shops shuttered and consumers hunkered down at home, official data showed on Thursday.

Header: South Korea: no new domestic coronavirus cases, no transmission from election
Description: [SEOUL] South Korea on Thursday reported no new domestic coronavirus cases for the first time since February, the Korea Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (KCDC) said.

Header: Tesla's Elon Musk calling US coronavirus lockdowns 'fascist' overshadows profitable quarter
Description: [BENGALURU] Tesla's outspoken chief executive officer (CEO) Elon Musk on Wednesday called sweeping US stay-at-home restrictions to curtail the coronavirus outbreak "fascist" as the electric carmaker posted its third quarterly profit in a row.

Header: Boeing to shrink workforce, raise cash as coronavirus slams jet industry
Description: [BENGALURU] Boeing Co said on Wednesday it would cut its 160,000-person workforce by about 10 per cent, further reduce 787 Dreamliner production and try to boost liquidity as it prepares for a years-long industry recovery from the coronavirus pandemic that drove its second consecutive quarterly loss.

Header: DBS Q1 profit falls to 2.5-year low on coronavirus loan loss provisions
Description: [SINGAPORE] Singapore's DBS Group Holdings set aside S$1.09 billion to cover the impact of the coronavirus pandemic as South-east Asia's biggest lender reported a 29 per cent fall in first-quarter profit to the lowest in 2.5 years.

Header: Tesla's profit streak not derailed by coronavirus as auto industry braces for losses
Description: [BENGALURU] Tesla Inc on Wednesday posted its third quarterly profit in a row but said the novel coronavirus was hurting deliveries and lockdown restrictions made it impossible for the electric carmaker to provide guidance for the full year.

Header: How the coronavirus crisis differs from other global downturns
Description: MARK Twain supposedly said: "History doesn't repeat but rather it rhymes."

Header: Debate over coronavirus 'immunity passports'
Description: The passports could create other issues - such as, according to research professor Claire Standley, a perverse incentive for people to deliberately infect themselves to obtain a certificate, allowing them to return to work.

Header: Mastercard sees spending return as economies open after coronavirus gloom
Description: [NEW YORK] Mastercard said it expects consumer spending to gradually return to "pre-Covid" levels as people start using their cards again on clothing and domestic travel with countries easing lockdown measures that have brought the world to a standstill.

Header: US: Wall St jumps on hopes of potential coronavirus drug
Description: [NEW YORK] US stocks opened higher on Wednesday after Gilead Sciences gave an encouraging update on a potential Covid-19 treatment, while upbeat earnings reports from Boeing and Google-parent Alphabet added to the sentiment.

Header: Coronavirus hammered US economy in first quarter
Description: [WASHINGTON] The US economy contracted in the first quarter at its sharpest pace since the Great Recession as stringent measures to slow the spread of the novel coronavirus almost shut down the country, ending the longest expansion in the nation's history.

Header: Barclays profit falls sharply as coronavirus hurts borrowers
Description: [LONDON] Barclays set aside £2.1 billion (S$3.7 billion) to cover a likely spike in loan losses as thousands of its corporate and consumer borrowers battle to cope with the financial fallout from the Covid-19 pandemic.

Header: StanChart eyes quick recovery as profit falls 12% on coronavirus crisis
Description: [LONDON] Standard Chartered (StanChart) on Wednesday said it expects virus-battered economies to recover later this year, striking an optimistic note after increased credit impairment and provisions for future loan losses pushed first-quarter profit down 12 per cent.

Header: Deutsche Bank swings to Q1 loss amid restructuring, coronavirus outbreak
Description: [FRANKFURT] Deutsche Bank swung to a loss in the first quarter as the bank undergoes a costly overhaul and battles pressure on revenue amid the coronavirus crisis, the German lender said on Wednesday.

Header: Indonesian startup Stoqo becomes latest casualty of coronavirus
Description: [JAKARTA] Stoqo Teknologi Indonesia, an online platform that supplies fresh ingredients to food outlets, is shutting down, becoming the latest casualty of the coronavirus outbreak.

Header: US government reveals details of sunlight study on coronavirus
Description: [WASHINGTON] The US Department of Homeland Security revealed to AFP on Tuesday new technical details regarding its highly anticipated study into how ultraviolet radiation destroys the new coronavirus, saying that its experiment had accurately mimicked natural sunlight.

Header: More than 2,200 US coronavirus deaths in 24 hours: tracker
Description: [WASHINGTON] The number of daily deaths from coronavirus rose again in the US on Tuesday, a tally from Johns Hopkins University showed, as the country's total fatalities surpassed those of Americans in the Vietnam War.

Header: US coronavirus deaths top Vietnam War toll: tracker
Description: [WASHINGTON] The number of US deaths from the novel coronavirus has surpassed the toll of Americans killed in the Vietnam War, the Johns Hopkins University tracker showed on Tuesday.

Header: IMF approves US$3.4b for Nigeria to address coronavirus
Description: [WASHINGTON] The IMF board on Tuesday approved US$3.4 billion in emergency financing for Nigeria to help deal with the economic damage inflicted by the coronavirus pandemic.

Header: Ford says 2nd-quarter loss due to coronavirus to exceed US$5b
Description: [DETROIT] Ford Motor Co on Tuesday posted a US$2 billion first-quarter loss due to the impact of the coronavirus pandemic and said it expected its loss in the second quarter to more than double as it weathers a shutdown of its North American plants.

Header: BP hikes debt, keeps dividend as coronavirus hammers profits
Description: BP'S first-quarter profit tumbled by two thirds and its debt climbed to its highest in at least five years as the novel coronavirus crisis hammered oil demand, but the energy major kept its dividend despite warning of exceptional uncertainty.

Header: Merck sees US$2.1b coronavirus hit to 2020 sales
Description: [NEW JERSEY] Merck & Co said on Tuesday it expects the coronavirus pandemic to reduce 2020 sales by more than US$2 billion, and the US drugmaker lowered its profit forecast as a big drop in doctors' office visits during the outbreak will take a hefty toll, sending its shares down more than 3 per cent.

Header: PepsiCo scraps forecast due to coronavirus crisis
Description: [BENGALURU] PepsiCo reported a rise in first-quarter revenue, but ditched its full-year forecast on Tuesday, citing uncertainty around the globe due to the novel coronavirus pandemic.

Header: Marks & Spencer strengthens liquidity to cope with coronavirus impact
Description: [LONDON] British retailer Marks & Spencer said it was planning for a slow return to shopping and had taken steps to shore up its finances for 18 months, including scrapping next year's dividend, to cope with the impact of the coronavirus crisis

Header: Trump was warned about coronavirus repeatedly in Jan and Feb: report
Description: [WASHINGTON] US President Donald Trump was repeatedly warned about the dangers of the novel coronavirus in intelligence briefings in January and February, The Washington Post reported late Monday.

Header: US airlines announce new policies to slow coronavirus spread
Description: [WASHINGTON] Major US airlines announced on Monday new health and safety measures to protect in-flight personnel and passengers from the coronavirus, even as states begin lifting restrictions.

Header: More than 2,200 Indonesians have died with coronavirus symptoms, data shows
Description: [BENGALURU] More than 2,200 Indonesians have died with acute symptoms of Covid-19 but were not recorded as victims of the disease, a Reuters review of data from 16 of the country's 34 provinces showed.

Header: US records 1,303 coronavirus deaths in 24 hours: Johns Hopkins
Description: [WASHINGTON] The United States recorded 1,303 more novel coronavirus deaths in the past 24 hours, according to figures reported late Monday by the Johns Hopkins University, with confirmed US cases nearing one million.

Header: Japan's March jobless rate rises to one-year high as coronavirus hits economy
Description: [TOKYO] Japan's March jobless rate rose to its highest in a year, while job availability slipped to a more than three-year low, official data showed on Tuesday, as the coronavirus outbreak and containment measures caused the nation's job market to ease.

Header: France daily coronavirus deaths rise to 437: official
Description: [PARIS] France on Monday reported 437 new deaths from Covid-19 in hospitals and nursing homes over the last 24 hours, marking a rise after lower daily figures in the last days.

Header: Why some fear a coronabond as much as the coronavirus
Description: EUROPE can see light at the end of the Covid-19 tunnel as the numbers of daily infections and deaths from the virus fall gradually across the continent. But the economic fallout from the "Great Lockdown" is still to come. The International Monetary Fund is forecasting that the eurozone will experience a drop in real GDP of more than 7 per cent this year and only partly recover in 2021, making this downturn deeper than even the Great Recession of 2008-09.

Header: Coronavirus disrupts gold mining but boosts metal's appeal
Description: WITH businesses the world over increasingly grinding to a halt as the Covid-19 pandemic turns daily life topsy-turvy, even industries intrinsically linked to safe havens have been forced to hunker down.

Header: White House suspends daily coronavirus briefings, to resume with new focus
Description: [WASHINGTON] The White House on Monday suspended daily coronavirus task force briefings but said they would resume later in the week as the focus shifts to the economic reopening phase in the fight against the novel coronavirus.

Header: UK airlines want coronavirus wage support scheme extended beyond June
Description: [LONDON] Britain's airlines want the government's coronavirus wage support scheme to be extended beyond June, maintaining the assistance for longer with a only slow recovery in air travel expected.

Header: Distilleries are turning stale beer into coronavirus whiskey
Description: [NEW YORK] A stainless-steel tanker winds down a gravel road, its 18 wheels coming to rest in front of a bright, red barn. A stubbled Vermonter in coveralls emerges from the structure and fits the rear of the truck with a thick hose. What flows out isn't fuel or feed, as you might suspect, but thousands of gallons of warm beer. The scene has become something of a morning ritual over the past month at WhistlePig, where the farmhouse distillery is receiving roughly 6,500 gallons of stale suds per day.

Header: Japan's Osaka to name and shame pachinko parlours defying coronavirus lockdown
Description: [TOKYO] Japan's Osaka Prefecture said it will name and shame more pachinko parlour gambling outlets that are defying coronavirus lockdown requests after three out of six locations it identified on Friday subsequently closed.

Header: Volkswagen restarts Europe's largest car factory after coronavirus shutdown
Description: [FRANKFURT] Volkswagen (VW) the world's largest carmaker by sales, on Monday said it had resumed work at its biggest factory in Wolfsburg, Germany, to give its workers time to adapt to new hygiene measures to combat the coronavirus.

Header: Fishing, surfing and hunting beckon New Zealanders after coronavirus lockdown
Description: [WELLINGTON] New Zealanders will be able to go fishing, surfing, hunting and hiking this week for the first time in more than a month as the country begins to ease its way out of a strict lockdown that successfully slowed the spread of the coronavirus.

Header: Mexican oil platforms to reduce staff due to coronavirus
Description: [MEXICO CITY] Mexico will begin removing staff from Gulf of Mexico oil platforms to limit the spread of the coronavirus, leaving only essential personnel on board, state oil firm Petroleos Mexicanos (Pemex) said on Sunday.

Header: US records 1,330 coronavirus deaths in 24 hours: Johns Hopkins
Description: [WASHINGTON] The United States recorded 1,330 more novel coronavirus deaths in the past 24 hours, according to figures reported late Sunday by the Johns Hopkins University.

Header: South Korea finance ministry says to boost loans to developing countries fighting coronavirus
Description: [SEOUL] South Korea's finance minister on Monday said the government will boost loans and grants for developing nations to help them fight the coronavirus pandemic.

Header: Canada warns against chloroquine use as coronavirus treatment
Description: [MONTREAL] Canadian health authorities have issued a warning against the use of anti-malarial drugs chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine to treat coronavirus infections or prevent reinfections.

Header: China eases restrictions on exports of some coronavirus equipment
Description: CHINA is dropping a requirement that a number of key virus care products get domestic regulatory approval before export, as long as they are approved in the importing countries, the commerce ministry said on Saturday.

Header: Deflation stalks the world after expansive policies of coronavirus era
Description: THE economic contraction wrought by efforts to contain the coronavirus is shredding inflation. Now deflation, a prolonged period of falling prices, is stalking the globe. The collapsing oil market is both a symptom of weaker demand and cause for a deepening slump.

Header: China says all coronavirus patients in Wuhan are discharged
Description: THE Chinese city of Wuhan, where the global coronavirus pandemic began, now has no remaining cases in its hospitals, a health official told reporters on Sunday.
